0: Federal customs officials have stopped more than 20,000 pairs of counterfeit luxury shoes from tip-toeing into the U.S. from China. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR U.S. Customs and Border Protection Spokesman Jaime Ruiz says four shipments of fake Christian Louboutin shoes were seized Tuesday, and another shipment was seized July 27. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Ruiz says the shoes could have sold for a total of $18 million in the U.S. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The vaunted French designer's shoes come in an array of colors and styles, often commanding thousands of dollars per pair from well-heeled customers.
